html: A synonymous parallelism identifies “mountains” as a metaphor for “kingdoms.” A similar synonymous parallelism elsewhere identifies “mountains” as a metaphor for “nations” (Isaiah 64:1-3). Jehovah sends the tempestuous Assyrian horde—the archtyrant and his military alliance—to make war on Jehovah’s people and on all nations. The tumult and uproar they cause in the world stems from their hatred toward Israel’s God and his people: “Woe to the many peoples in an uproar, who rage like the raging of the seas—tumultuous nations, in commotion like the turbulence of mighty waters!” (Isaiah 17:12).
